DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Data Domain Genetic Variation Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the variation type of the genes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Data Domain Genetic Variation Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to laboratory data.:Genetic Variation consists of deviation(s) in the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material of an individual from that typical of the group to which the individual belongs, or deviation(s) in the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material of offspring from that of its parents._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Property.preferredDefinition: Genetic Variation consists of deviation(s) in the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material of an individual from that typical of the group to which the individual belongs, or deviation(s) in the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material of offspring from that of its parents._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Genetic Variation consists of deviation(s) in the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material of an individual from that typical of the group to which the individual belongs, or deviation(s) in the nucleotide sequence of the genetic material of offspring from that of its parents.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An alteration or difference from a norm or standard._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.: The naturally-occurring, normal, non-mutated version of a gene or genome.: An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The naturally-occurring, normal, non-mutated version of a gene or genome.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having two identical allelic forms of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.: An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

Concepts.definition: Having two identical allelic forms of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having two different allelic forms of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.: An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

Concepts.definition: Having two different allelic forms of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having two different allelic forms of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.: A substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight.

Concepts.definition: Having two different allelic forms of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.
A substance formed by chemical union of two or more elements or ingredients in definite proportion by weight.
